title: In Crisis With Iran, U.S. Military Officials Focus on Strait of Hormuz
summary: Pentagon officials are trying to prepare for all of the ways Iran could retaliate, as President Trump hints at what he might do.

title: Record Debt Limit Increase Would Break Republican Precedent
summary: A proposed $5 trillion debt limit increase could make it hard for Republicans to maintain their fiscal hawk credibility.

title: ‘Little Lobbyists’ Urge Senators to Oppose Trump’s Bill Cutting Medicaid
summary: Children with disabilities and their parents who rely on the health insurance program took to Capitol Hill this week to warn that the proposed reductions could be ‘devastating.’

title: William G. Young, a Reagan-Appointed Judge, Is Fast-Tracking Trump to Trial
summary: Judge William G. Young’s long career has been punctuated by high-profile cases and outspoken advocacy for the judiciary’s value and fact-finding power.

title: U.S. v. Skrmetti: How the Transgender Rights Movement Bet on the Supreme Court and Lost
summary: The inside story of the case that could set the movement back a generation.

title: What to Know About United States v. Skrmetti
summary: A Times examination shows how a landmark case about gender-affirming care for minors was built on flawed politics and uncertain science.

title: China Is Hacking Russia to Steal War Secrets
summary: Since the war in Ukraine began, analysts have monitored a series of intrusions aimed at stealing information about weaponry and warfighting.

title: No Rock Stars, No Mercedes: A Russian Expo Shows the Cost of Divorce With the West
summary: The annual economic forum in St. Petersburg used to yield multibillion-dollar deals and feature performances by global music stars. With the war in Ukraine still raging, the mood has shifted.

title: ‘SVU’ Star Mariska Hargitay on Her Mother Jayne Mansfield
summary: In a new documentary made by the “Law & Order: SVU” star, she examines her own clouded origins and the mother she barely knew: Jayne Mansfield.

title: How Black Lung Came Roaring Back to Coal Country
summary: Once nearly eradicated, the “old man’s disease” is back and suffocating younger miners. Federal cuts risk putting a solution further out of reach.

title: Fed’s Interest-Rate Approach Keeps It on Collision Course With Trump
summary: The central bank signals little urgency to cut interest rates despite demands from President Trump for lower borrowing costs.

title: Zero Interest Rates Are Back in Europe
summary: The Swiss National Bank lowered rates to zero after consumer prices fell last month. Other European central banks are grappling with uncertainty caused by President Trump’s tariffs.

title: U.S. Heat Wave Forecast: When High Temperatures Will Affect You
summary: Friday is the first day of summer. And boy, will it feel like it.

title: Hurricane Erick Makes Landfall in Mexico as a Major Storm
summary: The hurricane had been a Category 4 storm as it bore down from the eastern Pacific toward Mexico. The authorities ordered evacuations in Oaxaca and Guerrero.

title: Cannes Lions Festival Plays Host to a Messy Business Divorce
summary: Michael Kassan, a ringmaster in the media industry, is going head to head at its top event with United Talent Agency, a company that has sued him.

title: TikTok Hits Cannes, Where a U.S. Ban Seems a Distant Dream
summary: TikTok executives hosted happy hours and played pickleball with influencers on the French Riviera this week, even as a U.S. ban loomed over the company.

title: A Trump Executive Order Could Affect Ukrainian Refugees in Iowa
summary: The Trump administration suspended a temporary humanitarian program for Ukrainians. Now many are losing their ability to work, and fear deportation.

title: Vera Rubin Observatory Brings Universe’s Darkest Mysteries Into Focus
summary: As the Vera C. Rubin Observatory surveys the night sky, astrophysicists expect to unlock the secrets of dark matter, dark energy and cosmic phenomena that go “bang!”

title: Belgian Nonprofit Papy Boom Is Helping Retirement-Home Residents Hit the Clubs
summary: A group of Brussels retirement-home residents grooved to electronic music late one night as part of a program to fight loneliness among seniors.

title: The Supreme Court Fails to See Transgender Teens
summary: The retrenchment on transgender rights is fueled by fear: fear of the future, fear of unfamiliar concepts, fear of not knowing one’s child.

title: The Progressive Regulator Winning Over the Populist Right
summary: Lina Khan wants to overthrow “the autocrats of trade.”

title: A Legal Gamble
summary: We explain the Supreme Court’s ruling on medical treatments for transgender kids.

title: On Juneteenth, This Williamsburg Schoolhouse Finds a New Life
summary: Beginning on Juneteenth, a restored Virginia schoolhouse where enslaved and free Black students were taught to read is on view in Colonial Williamsburg.

title: Texas Might Ban Hemp
summary: Gov. Greg Abbott must decide this week whether to sign or veto a bill to ban hemp-derived intoxicants, part of a national debate over the fast-growing industry.

title: Student Who Filmed Himself Raping at Least 10 Women Is Given Life Sentence
summary: Zou Zhenhao, 28, is considered by the police in London to be “one of the most prolific predators” they have encountered. Investigators say there are probably many more victims.

title: The Crane That Ruined Florence’s Skyline Is Gone
summary: A reviled crane used during the expansion of the Uffizi Galleries was taken down this week after years of protests.
